comments.body: It's pretty weird putting this stuff in `CFLAGS`, but it seemed to ignore it otherwise. If someone has some better ideas here, that would be great. Maybe `feather-format` needs to be using `CXXFLAGS` or it calls it something else (`CPPFLAGS`?).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@if [ "$(uname)" == "Darwin" ]; then
    export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.7
    export CFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS} -stdlib=libc++ -std=c++11"
    export CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS} -stdlib=libc++ -std=c++11"
fi

comments.body: If 10.7 is the earliest deployment target supporting C++11 we should update the docs in the Feather repo too

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@
if [ "$(uname)" == "Darwin" ]; then
    export MACOSX_DEPLOYMENT_TARGET=10.7
    export CFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS} -stdlib=libc++ -std=c++11"
    export CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS} -stdlib=libc++ -std=c++11"
